alert.note: Alert for Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:23AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Van Buren, northern Scotland and northwestern Clark Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1223 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Milton, or 10 miles southeast of Bloomfield, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Milton around 1230 AM CDT. Cantril around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Granger and Luray. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
